title: Hotel Reviews Analytics
text:
1. Introduction to the Project
üëã Hotel Reviews Analytics
Analyzing Hotel Reviews with Sentiment Analysis & Topic Modeling
Project Overview: This project builds upon work I completed during my PhD, where I gathered and analyzed 16,813 reviews from 42 hotels located in Italy, Austria, Spain, and Denmark. The dataset includes reviews across a variety of categories such as cleanliness, location, staff, comfort, breakfast, and more. The main goal was to apply Sentiment Analysis and Topic Modeling to derive insights into customer experiences and the performance of the hotels.

title: Hotel Reviews Analytics
text:
2. Why is this survey important?
üè® Why Analyze Hotel Reviews?

Improve customer service based on feedback.

Enhance marketing strategies using sentiment insights.

Identify key topics discussed by customers (e.g., cleanliness, location, amenities).

title: Hotel Reviews Analytics
text:
3. Dataset structure
üìå Dataset:
- Reviews from Booking.com - raw text.
üìä Methods Used:
- Sentiment Analysis: Classifies reviews into Positive, Negative, or Neutral.
- Topic Modeling: Identifies common themes and keywords in the reviews.

title: Hotel Reviews Analytics
text:
4. Project Pages Overview (I)

Œôntroduction & Dataset Overview


Brief introduction to the dataset and the purpose of the analysis. Overview of the reviews, sentiment distribution, and hotel categories.


Sentiment Analysis


Visual representation of sentiment distribution (positive, negative, and neutral reviews). Insights into which aspects of hotels influence sentiment.

title: Hotel Reviews Analytics
text:
5. Project Pages Overview (II)

Topic Modeling


Key themes derived from the reviews (e.g., cleanliness, location, staff, etc.). Word Cloud and topic analysis to reveal the most frequently discussed topics.


Dashboard


An interactive dashboard that allows users to explore reviews based on hotel, category, or sentiment. Interactive charts and graphs to view the data dynamically.

title: Hotel Reviews Analytics
text:
6. Dashboard Overview
üéØ Features of the Dashboard
Sentiment Trends üìà Word Cloud of Review Topics ‚òÅÔ∏è Review Distribution by Sentiment üìä The dashboard allows users to interact with the data, filter reviews, and explore sentiment trends and topics in-depth.

title: Hotel Reviews Analytics
text:
7. Thank You
Thank you for your attention! üôè Any questions? üí¨

title: Who am I
text:
A few words about me


My name is Christiana Andreou.



I graduated in 2017 from Agios Nikolaos High School in Limassol, Cyprus. From 2017 to 2021, I pursued my Bachelor‚Äôs degree at the Cyprus University of Technology in the Department of Communication and Internet Studies. In 2024, I started a new Master‚Äôs program at the Cyprus University of Technology, which has just been introduced. The program is titled Experiential Digital Marketing.


Find me at GitHub or send me an email chra.andreou@edu.cut.ac.cy

title: Course overview
text:
What is a Dashboard?

Dashboards provide a visual display of the most important information needed to achieve one or more objectives.
They consolidate and arrange information on a single screen.

Key Characteristics of Effective Dashboards

Clarity: Information should be easy to read and interpret.
Accuracy: Data must be accurate and up-to-date.
Relevance: Content should align with user goals and needs.

title: Course overview
text: Definition by Stephen Few

title: Course overview
text:
The Role of Visual Design

Minimize distractions and unnecessary elements.
Use consistent layouts and formatting.
Apply thoughtful use of color and typography.

Best Practices for Dashboard Design

Avoid clutter: Only display essential information.
Prioritize data: Highlight key metrics and KPIs.
Use visual hierarchy: Direct the viewer‚Äôs focus to the most important elements.

title: Course overview
text:
Common Pitfalls to Avoid

Overloading the user with too much data.
Using overly complex or inconsistent designs.
Neglecting the importance of user testing.

What You Shoud Do

Focus on the needs and goals of the dashboard‚Äôs end-users.
Iteratively test and refine designs to improve usability.

title: Course overview
text:
Summary

Dashboards are powerful tools for decision-making.
Effective dashboards balance clarity, relevance, and visual appeal.
Avoid common pitfalls by focusing on user needs and testing designs.
